title: Man Tries To Smuggle 8 Gold Bars Worth Rs 36 Lakh Inside His Shoes, Caught At Delhi Airport

Man Tries To Smuggle 8 Gold Bars Worth Rs 36 Lakh Inside His Shoes, Caught At Delhi Airport

Man Tries To Smuggle 8 Gold Bars Worth Rs 36 Lakh Inside His Shoes, Caught At Delhi Airport

When it comes to smuggling things through an airport security, people come up with weirdly wonderful hacks.

One of the biggest and most popular concealment and smuggling item through a security scanner is of course, Gold.

From scrunchies, maggi packets to even shoving it up the rectum (regardless of the pain) smugglers go to some mind boggling extent to get the stuff through.

Reuters

More recently, a man was nabbed at the Delhi airport for smuggling gold bars worth more than Rs 36 lakh by hiding them in his shoes.

According to PTI, he was coming on a flight from Dubai, and Officers of the Air Customs Preventive at Indira Gandhi International Airport intercepted the passenger on a tip-off.

A detailed search resulted in the recovery of eight gold bars weighing 933 grams which were concealed inside the shoes worn by him, he said.

The market value of the seized gold bars is approximately Rs 36,48,030, according to the statement. The gold has been seized and the man was arrested under relevant provisions of the Customs Act, reports PTI.
